subject: Career
title: Presenteeism: The Cost of Showing Up Sick
description: A micro-lesson that makes Presenteeism: The Cost of Showing Up Sick usable.

hook.text: She came to work with the flu. Everyone praised her dedication. She infected three coworkers and made 12 errors.

buildup.text: Presenteeism: being physically present but mentally or physically impaired. It costs more than absenteeism.

discovery.text: Harvard estimates presenteeism costs US employers $150 billion annually â€” far more than sick days.

twist.text: Remote work made presenteeism worse. You can now be 'logged in' with a fever, and nobody even notices.

climax.text: Real productivity requires being genuinely able to work. Taking a sick day isn't weakness â€” it's efficiency.

punchline.text: Showing up broken costs more than staying home to heal.

quiz.question: How much does presenteeism cost US employers annually?
